main.name: Eric Chen
main.description: Here you'll learn about what I do, what I've done, and what I am interested in doing.
main.bio: I am currently in my final year at Cornell University pursuing a Masters of Engineering in computer science. I am passionate about the intersection between artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data science. In my free time I like to play basketball and ocassionally watch TV or sports.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of the software and technologies I have been using and my experience in each skill.

education.degree: Masters of Engineering in Computer Science

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: I am a teaching assistant for differential equations, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and computer organization. For the differential equations class, I prepared worksheets and lectures for students in the class and met biweekly with other facilitators to learn and train about active learning techniques. For the other classes, I helped grade homework and exams for respective class and held office hours to help students understand the material.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Created a Spring Boot application as a REST API controller for the backend and used ReactJS app for user interface, which applied changes to the backend. Then used Maven packaging to build backend and frontend into a single war file web application for deployment onto Apache Tomact server.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Used Python Flask web framework to connect Postgresql to Python through ORM and Graphql. Then wrote Python script to create nodes and relationships for company models in Neo4j graph database.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Used data intelligence platform powered by Splunk to search, analyze, and visualize big data. Wrote Python code and regex to format Android log files and index them into Splunk for analysis. Then developed Python modules to analyze Android HMI tickets by important attributes such as Priority and Date and generate reports for tickets without log files.

projects.title: CSMA/CD simulator

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
